snippet: Starts for single-family homes increased in March, but the gains made only a tiny dent in losses of the previous month.
abstract: Commerce Dept reports that housing starts increased 2 percent to seasonally adjusted 926,000 in March, falling short of analyst expectations; Labor Dept reports that applications for weekly unemployment benefits rose 12,000 to seasonally adjusted 294,000, though underlying trend continues to suggest tightening job market.
lead_paragraph: Starts for single-family homes increased in March, but the gains made only a tiny dent in losses of the previous month.

headline.main: Rise in Housing Starts Is Less Than Expected
headline.print_headline: Data on Home Construction Is Below Forecasts, but Jobs Figures Are Steady
